com.storytron.uber

Class Role

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.uber.Role
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class Role
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Role that an Actor can assume during performance of an event. It determines how Actors assuming a Role are affected by the event, and describes which reactions the Actor can have.

    A Role has a collection of emotional reaction scripts, manipulable through getEmotions(), getEmotionIndex(String), getEmotionScript(String), addEmotion(int, Script), #addEmotion(Verb, Operator), #deleteEmotion(String).

    A Role has a collection of Role.Options, manipulable through getOptions(), getOption(String), getOptionIndex(String), #addOption(Deikto, com.storytron.uber.Role.Option), #addOption(Deikto, int, com.storytron.uber.Role.Option) #addOption(Deikto, Verb), #addOptionWithWordSockets(Verb), #deleteOption(Deikto, int), deleteOption(Deikto, String), #deleteOption(Deikto, com.storytron.uber.Role.Option).

    A Role has also an Script that determines if an actor can assume the Role, manipulable through getAssumeRoleIfScript(), setAssumeRoleIfScript(Script). It also has a label which serves to identify it.

    See Also:
